DataElement.preferredName: Patient Abdominal Carcinomatosis Abscess Or Gastrointestinal Obstruction And Additional Therapeutic Procedure Negation Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient has(had) abdominal carcinomatosis, abscess or GI obstruction and has not been evaluated for additional treatment that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Abdominal Carcinomatosis Abscess Or Gastrointestinal Obstruction And Additional Therapeutic Procedure Negation Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Of, or related to, the abdomen._A condition in which cancer is spread widely throughout the body, or, in some cases, to a relatively large region of the body._Accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Pertaining to the stomach and intestines._Blockage of a passageway._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Added; extra; further._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Abdominal Carcinomatosis Abscess Or Gastrointestinal Obstruction And Additional Therapeutic Procedure Negation Evaluation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria

It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Added; extra; further.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.
Carcinoma that has spread diffusely to an anatomic site or throughout the body.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Added; extra; further.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have abdominal c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have abdominal carcinomatosis, a history of non-recent intra-abdominal abscess, or a history of non-recent GI obstruction and has not been evaluated for the potential need for additional treatment before coming on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have had evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, GI obstruction and abdominal carcinomatosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, GI obstruction and abdominal carcinomatosis which are known risk factors for bowel perforation which have not been evaluated for the potential need for additional treatment before coming on study?
